data.title: Great Place for Special Diets
data.text: The prices were great. The service was incredible. The food was wonderful especially when you have special dietary needs.

data.title: Good food.
data.text: Lots of home soups to select from daily.  You need to know what you want when you get in line because they are VERY busy.  So, study the menu before you get into line.

data.title: Best Soup Selection in Detroit
data.text: If you love soup for lunch, then this is the place to go.  Every day they have @ least a dozen choices & you can sample 1st so you know what you're getting.  I've never had anything else there so can't offer an opinion on their sandwiches & hot dishes, though they too look very good.

data.title: You must go here for lunch
data.text: I have tried over a dozen kinds of soup and none disappoint.  It is great with a tasting you know you will enjoy a bowl or a cup.  The salads and wraps are good too and very fresh.

data.title: Outstanding Soup and Selection of Soups
data.text:
I visited today for the first time and the very friendly man behind the counter suggested I sample a couple of soups.  I tried the African Peanut Soup and the Grilled Cheese and Tomato soup and the African Peanut was the winner.
It is very good.  I will be back

data.title: Great Food!
data.text: I wanted to surprise my boyfriend for his birthday and ordered him lunch from Lunchtime Global since he works in the same building. I talked to Carrie and she helped me choose a meal to be ready for pick up. Carrie was friendly and helpful. My boyfriend rated the Copenhagen salad excellent, the mushroom-quinoa soup excellent, the chicken noodle soup excellent and the brownie just ok. I think it was overbaked as he said the taste was good but it was very dry...and he loves chocolate. I would highly recommend this restaurant for both their food and their great customer service. Thanks Carrie!

data.title: Great place for lunch
data.text:
This is a great option for lunch in the downtown area.  There is definitely a line to get in, so I suggest arriving early!  There is decent seating in the restaurant, but there also seems to be a pretty brisk takeout business.

I ordered a salad, which ended up being very good.  It was freshly made to order, and came with a large portion of chicken.  The staff was very friendly, and the whole ordering process fairly efficient.

There was a good variety of salads and sandwiches to choose from.  This place definitely has repeat potential!!

data.title: AMAZING SOUP!!!
data.text: They have the best soups. Typically they offer at least 8 different soups every day. The also have an excellent selection of sandwiches and salads. If you are not in the mood for something heavy to eat. They have a cold case with veggies and hummus dip as well as yogurts to choose from.

data.title: Great Take Out for Lunch
data.text: Everything is fresh, made daily, with an outstanding choice of salads, soups, sandwiches.  Good ingredients and terrific combination of items, with excellent value for your money.

data.title: Plethora of soups lacking flavor...
data.text: Full disclosure, I have not had each and every soup offered, however, the soups I have tried have been extremely salty and lacking flavor tremendously.  The chicken caesar salad was also lack lustre and frankly, a disappointment.  It likely to try it again.  Too many lunch options Downtown to settle for mediocrity.

data.title: My go-to spot
data.text: Whether you want soup (they have 10 or so from scratch daily), salad or a sandwich - everything is great. You'll love it - I guarantee it. Best lunch spot in the Business district area.

data.title: Great Lunch Spot
data.text: Great lunch spot inside the First National Building. Make sure to use the main entrance on Congress Street. Excellent options for dining in and to-go. I would recommend going with a half-sandwich, as they are very large. Huge soup variety and they also offer a hot food special daily. Get there before Noon to beat the rush.
